description: APPLICATION FOR A LAWFUL DEVELOPMENT CERTIFICATE IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF HIP TO GABLE AND REAR DORMER ROOF EXTENSIONS AND INSERTION OF X2 ROOFLIGHTS TO FRONT ROOFSLOPE AND X1 SIDE WINDOW AT ROOF LEVEL.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The erection of a hip to gable and rear roof extension and insertion of x1 side window at first floor would consist of the enlargement of a dwelling house within the meaning of Class B of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class B. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 2 - The insertion of x2 rooflights to front roofslope would consist of any other alteration to the roof of the dwelling house within the meaning of Class C of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development)  (England) Order 2015 "the Order" and would comply with the development tolerances set out in said Class C. The operation would therefore have been granted planning permission by Article 3 of the Order.

Condition : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant should be aware that the site may provide a useful habitat for swifts. Swifts are currently in decline in the UK and in order to encourage and improve the conservation of swifts the applicant is advised to consider the installation of swift nesting box/bricks on site.

Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is advised that the side window inserted at first floor level must be obscure-glazed and non-opening for the parts of the window which can be opened above 1.7 metres from the floor of the room in which the window is installed, in order to comply with Class B B.2 (c), Schedule 2, Part 1 of the GPDO 2015 (as amended). Failure to comply with this limitation may render the development unlawful and subject to enforcement action.
